etymologies: Old English wull, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wol and German Wolle, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin lana ‘wool’, vellus ‘fleece’

definitions: the fine, soft curly or wavy hair forming the coat of a sheep, goat, or similar animal, especially when shorn and prepared for use in making cloth or yarn

examples.text: Harris tweed is made from pure new wool

shortDefinitions: fine, soft curly or wavy hair forming coat of sheep

definitions: yarn or textile fiber made from wool

examples.text: carpets made of 80 percent wool and 20 percent nylon

shortDefinitions: yarn or textile fibre made from wool

definitions: the soft underfur or down of some mammals
shortDefinitions: soft underfur or down of some mammals

definitions: a metal or mineral made into a mass of fine fibers
shortDefinitions: metal or mineral made into mass of fine fibres

phrases.text: pull the wool over someone's eyes
